statement.p: The length of the near field of an ultrasonic tester is given by \displaystyle{L}=\frac{{D}^{{2}}}{{{4}\lambda}} where \displaystyle{D} is the diameter of the transducer (depends on crystal size) and \displaystyle\lambda is the wavelength. If \displaystyle{D}={0.015} and the wavelength is \displaystyle\lambda={736.25} in 1020 steel, what is the length of the near field? Â
